noun.description: Biology. The evolutionary process that gives rise to a new anatomical structure or feature; the development of a neomorph; an instance of this.
Genetics. The property of being a neomorph.
Geology. The diagenetic transformation of a mineral which results in its replacement by new crystals of the same mineral or of a polymorph.

origin: Late 19th century. From neo- + -morphism. In sense 1 after neomorph.
